text.paragraph: Radiology Reports

item.paragraph: (MRI Spine Lumbar WO Cont) Reason For Exam: M48.061 - LUMBAR STENOSIS

paragraph.content:
EXAMINATION: MR200023013, 2021-05-05 1:00 PM, MRI SPINE LUMBAR WO CONT
CLINICAL: Lumbar spinal stenosis. Chronic low back pain. Left lumbar radiculopathy.
COMPARISON: 2009-02-15 lumbar spine MRI.
TECHNICAL: Multiplanar multisequence MRI of the lumbar spine without intravenous contrast.
FINDINGS:
The conus appears normal and terminates at L1. Vertebral body heights are maintained. Bilateral mild neural foraminal narrowing secondary to facet degenerative change at T11-12.
T12/L1: No disc bulge or central canal narrowing. Bilateral facet osteoarthritis with mild bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.
L1/2: No disc bulge or central canal narrowing. Mild bilateral facet osteoarthritis and neural foraminal narrowing.
L2/3: Grade 1 anterolisthesis of L2 on L3 with circumferential disc bulge and moderate central canal narrowing. Bilateral facet osteoarthritis and ligamentum flavum hypertrophy with moderate bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.
L3/4: Circumferential disc bulge with superimposed central and right paracentral disc extrusion and severe central canal narrowing with compression of the bilateral transiting L4 nerve roots. Bilateral facet osteoarthritis and ligamentum flavum hypertrophy with severe left and moderate right neural foraminal narrowing.
L4/5: Circumferential disc bulge with compression of the bilateral transiting L5 nerve roots and moderate central canal narrowing. Bilateral facet osteoarthritis and ligamentum flavum hypertrophy with severe bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.
L5/S1: Mild circumferential disc bulge and central canal narrowing. Bilateral facet osteoarthritis and ligamentum flavum hypertrophy with mild bilateral neural foraminal narrowing.
No mass or fluid collection in the spinal canal. No suspicious bone marrow signal. No acute soft tissue findings. There has been laminectomy at L3-4 and L4-5 with granulation tissue formation in the postsurgical defects. There is no fluid collection in the postoperative bed. Mild bilateral sacroiliac joint osteoarthritis.
IMPRESSION:
There has been overall worsening of disc and facet degenerative change in the lumbar spine with multilevel prominent facet and disc degeneration, most notably at L3-4 and L4-5. This includes severe neural foraminal narrowing at these levels.
This report was dictated at Workstation ID: PLA62126

Dictation Date/Time: 2021-05-05 2:25 pm
Dictating Radiologist : Wilkerson , Benjamin Wade, MD
Signing Radiologist : Wilkerson , Benjamin Wade, MD
Final Signed Date/Time: 2021-05-05 2:22 pm
